com.sri.ai.grinder.theory.differencearithmetic

Class DifferenceArithmeticLiteralSide

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.sri.ai.grinder.core.AbstractExpression
      • com.sri.ai.expresso.helper.AbstractExpressionWrapper
        • com.sri.ai.grinder.theory.differencearithmetic.DifferenceArithmeticLiteralSide
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Expression, java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Cloneable, java.lang.Comparable<java.lang.Object>

    public class DifferenceArithmeticLiteralSide
extends AbstractExpressionWrapper
    A specialized Expression representation of a difference arithmetic literal side (valid of the other side is zero) that provides the positive, negative and constant terms in it.
    Author:
    braz
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  DifferenceArithmeticLiteralSide.DifferenceArithmeticLiteralSideException 
      static class  DifferenceArithmeticLiteralSide.DuplicateTermException
      An error during the construction of a DifferenceArithmeticLiteralSide indicating that a term is duplicate (with the same sign), thus making the given expression impossible to represent as a DifferenceArithmeticLiteralSide because the term needs to be multiplied by a constant.
      static class  DifferenceArithmeticLiteralSide.InvalidLiteralException
      An error indicating that an expression is not a different arithmetic literal.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      DifferenceArithmeticLiteralSide(Expression comparisonSide)
      Given a sum, or an expression to be interpreted as a single-term sum, returns a triple containing a multiset of positive terms, a multiset of negative terms, and the sum of all numerical constants in it.
      DifferenceArithmeticLiteralSide(java.util.Set<Expression> positiveTerms, java.util.Set<Expression> negativeTerms, int constant)

      • DifferenceArithmeticLiteralSide

        public DifferenceArithmeticLiteralSide(java.util.Set<Expression> positiveTerms,

                                       int constant)

      • DifferenceArithmeticLiteralSide

        public DifferenceArithmeticLiteralSide(Expression comparisonSide)
                                throws DifferenceArithmeticLiteralSide.DuplicateTermException
        Given a sum, or an expression to be interpreted as a single-term sum, returns a triple containing a multiset of positive terms, a multiset of negative terms, and the sum of all numerical constants in it. If makeDuplicateError is non-null and a duplicate term is found, the duplicate is passed to it as a parameter and the resulting Error is thrown.
        Parameters:
        comparisonSide -
        Throws:
        DifferenceArithmeticLiteralSide.DuplicateTermException

      • makeDifferenceArithmeticNonZeroSideOfLiteralEquivalentTo

        public static DifferenceArithmeticLiteralSide makeDifferenceArithmeticNonZeroSideOfLiteralEquivalentTo(Expression numericalComparison)
                                                                                                throws DifferenceArithmeticLiteralSide.DuplicateTermException,
                                                                                                       DifferenceArithmeticLiteralSide.InvalidLiteralException
        Given a numerical comparison, return the non-zero side of an equivalent difference arithmetic literal with the other size equal to zero.
        Parameters:
        numericalComparison - a numerical comparison expression
        Returns:
        a DifferenceArithmeticLiteralSide representing the non-zero side of an literal equivalent to numericalComparison that has the other side equal to zero.
        Throws:
        DifferenceArithmeticLiteralSide.DuplicateTermException - thrown when a term appears with the same sign on the same side of a literal, meaning that the comparison cannot be a difference arithmetic literal.
        DifferenceArithmeticLiteralSide.InvalidLiteralException - thrown when the numerical comparison cannot be converted to a difference arithmetic literal.

      • getPositives

        public java.util.Set<Expression> getPositives()
